moves.title: Reflector (Down Special)
changes: Behavior normalized with Fox, Wolf and Ness (only changes vertical acceleration when held)

moves.title: Up Tilt
changes: Initial hitbox properties adjusted to make more sense in hitbox viewers
Now has darkness effect on hit

moves.title: Final Smash
changes: Completely revamped; Instead of simply healing 60% and giving 3 Solar Beam charges, it now heals 30% initially and gives increased walking, dashing, running, and air speed in addition to passive healing (1% per 36 Frames) and infinite Solar Beams for 15 seconds (900 Frames). Additionally, when the Final Smash is active, any Solar Beams used take away an entire second (60 Frames) of duration alongside aerial Solar Beams no longer putting Ivysaur into free-fall (aerial Solar Beams used outside the Final Smash’s duration still put Ivysaur into free-fall).

moves.title: Inhale (Neutral Special)
changes: PK Flash frame data now matches Ness
Bowser Fireball now properly terminates on hit
Samus Charge Shot frame data now matches Samus
Zero Suit Samus blaster projectile velocity now matches ZSS
Falcon Punch turnaround behavior matched to Captain Falcon
Shadow Ball movement now matches Mewtwo’s

moves.title: Final Cutter (Up Special)
changes: Cutter Dash input deadzone removed

moves.title: Spin Dash (Down Special)
changes: Can no longer be used to Bucket Brake

moves.title: Up Smash
changes: Hit 1 Damage 4 > 6, Hits 3 and 4 now function similarly to PM 3.6, angles now match 3.6

moves.title: Extreme Speed (Up Special)
changes: Hitbox now always sends in the direction Lucario is moving

moves.title: Other
changes: Back roll IASA 33 > 32

moves.title: Spin Dash (Down Special)
changes: Can no longer be used to Bucket Brake

moves.title: Other
changes: Eggs no longer despawn when Yoshi dies
Ungrabbable hurtboxes during shield made intangible to prevent any shieldpoking edge cases

moves.title: Down Special (Waft)
changes: Can no longer die off the top with his own Waft

moves.title: D-Pad functionality for alternate stage loading fixed
Fixed issue where trying to add more stages to page 3 than were present on page 1 would result in duplicate stage slots instead of what was desired
A dummy file is included so that single-pac stages on the dual-pac slots (Lylat Cruise and Castle Siege) can load faster and have more leniency towards content included

Camera speed (2.0) is now hardcoded, meaning that stages can be read off of the Brawl disc and still maintain a PM camera. (Likewise prevents unintended camera speeds from importing stage files and makes sure Stage Builder stages maintain this speed.)
As a result of this code, several Brawl stages return in their original formats as hidden alts!
The X button has been designated the ASL input intended for hidden Brawl stages as a homage to the Japanese name for the game: Dairantou Smash Bros X
Over 50 stages have been optimized, saving space for new additions
Two new stage slots added! Poke Floats and Rainbow Cruise.
All 64, Melee and Brawl multiplayer stages return!
Battlefield
changes: Fixed issue where lighting would instantly swap settings during certain times of the in-stage day

changes.title: (L-alt) Brinstar Depths (NEW!)
changes: The Melee stage returns, having its own music tracklist separate from Brinstar’s

changes.title: (Z-alt) Brinstar Depths FD (NEW!)
changes: A 1:1 of Final Destination

changes.title: (X-alt) Castle Siege (Brawl)
changes: Moved from the Y-alt input for consistency reasons

changes.title: (L-alt) White Wafers (NEW!)
changes: A wintry stage where meteored opponents can get caught in the thick snow!

changes.title: (L+R-alt) Venom (NEW!)
changes: A port of the SSBM stage

changes.title: (X-alt) Final Destination (Brawl) (NEW!)
changes: Brawl FD is playable again outside of Classic!

changes.title: (L-alt) Phendrana
changes: Moved from Norfair’s Z-alt

changes.title: (X-alt) Frigate Orpheon (Brawl) (NEW!)
changes: Slightly different platform movement than PM’s, no ledge on the right of the starting form

changes.title: (L-alt) New Pork City (PM)
changes: Fixed issue where the soundbank and effectbank were not loaded

changes.title: (L+X-alt) New Pork City (Brawl) (NEW!)
changes: Similar to the PM version, a handful of platforms are in different locations relative to it

changes.title: (Default and R-alt) Golden Temple
changes: Clouds now have smoother animation; foliage and polygon count improved

moves.title: Green Hill Zone
changes: Lighting slightly adjusted to better contrast foreground and background

changes.title: (Base Stage) Halberd
changes: Claw Arm is no longer removed from the stage, though it doesn’t attack by default.

changes.title: (X-alt) Halberd (Brawl) (NEW!)
changes: Matches the base stage, but the claw arm can attack as in Brawl

changes.title: (L-alt) Ganon’s Castle
changes: Converted into a Metal Cavern 1:1 due to shape similarities, aesthetically remains similar to before

changes.title: (Z-alt) Great Bay
changes: Swimming is now optional, use Y+Z to access it without functional water

changes.title: (Z-alt) Icicle Mountain (NEW!)
changes: The Melee autoscroller returns

changes.title: Fixed problem where the stage had rendering issues near the lower entryways
(X-alt) Tilting Lylat Cruise
changes: Moved from the Y-alt input for consistency reasons

changes.title: (L-alt) Mario Circuit Light (NEW!)
changes: A more competitively-designed Mario Circuit

changes.title: (Y-alt) Mushroom Kingdom Melee (NEW!)
changes: A recreation of SSBM’s stage to the current best capabilities Brawl modding can achieve

changes.title: (Base Slot) Norfair
changes: Reverted to Brawl Norfair, moved from the L-alt slot

changes.title: (L-alt) Crateria
changes: Moved from Brinstar’s L-alt

changes.title: (Z-alt) Crateria ML
changes: Moved from Brinstar’s Z-alt

changes.title: (L-alt) Princess Peach’s Castle (NEW!)
changes: A port of the Melee stage, albeit without hazards

changes.title: (Base Slot) Pictochat
changes: Modules fixed to have appropriate PM/Brawl behavior

changes.title: (R-alt) Pictochat CS
changes: Added a “C” in the background to be consistent with other versions of the stage

changes.title: (X-alt) PictoChat (Brawl) (NEW!)
changes: Includes some transformations omitted in the base slot

changes.title: (Z-alt) Molgera Battle MC
changes: Given its own tracklist

changes.title: (Base) Poke Floats
changes: Returns in all of its Melee glory

changes.title: (R-alt) Poke Floats PS2 (NEW!)
changes: A green Pokemon Stadium 2 in the air among the floats

changes.title: (L-alt) Poke Floats 2 (NEW!)
changes: A variant of Poke Floats featuring different patterns and Pokemon

changes.title: (Z-alt) Pokemon Stadium
changes: Moved from Saffron City’s L-alt

changes.title: (X-alt) Pokemon Stadium 2 (Brawl) (NEW!)
changes: The return of the transforming version of the stage

changes.title: (X-alt) Port Town (Brawl) (NEW!)
changes: A ledgeless version with different car knockback and a separate tracklist

changes.title: (Base) Rainbow Cruise
changes: Moved from Peach's Castle's L-alt

changes.title: (R-alt) Rainbow Cruise WL (NEW!)
changes: A Wario Land 1:1 featuring a Rainbow Cruise aesthetic

changes.title: (L-alt) Bob-Omb Battlefield (NEW!)
changes: A stage on a floating island with looping platforms and a Water Bubble hazard!

changes.title: (Z-alt) Mushroom Gorge (NEW!)
changes: An open stage featuring two very high platforms and a functional Mushroom Trampoline!

changes.title: (Y-alt) Dr. Mario’s Lab
changes: Moved from Mario Circuit’s L-alt

changes.title: (X-alt) Rumble Falls (Brawl)
changes: Moved from the Y-alt input for consistency reasons

changes.title: (L+X-alt) 75M (NEW!)
changes: Yep, it’s this stage.

changes.title: (L-alt) Pokemon Amie PS2 (NEW!)
changes: A Pokemon Stadium 2 1:1 featuring the visuals of Pokemon Amie

changes.title: (L-alt) Pumpkin Hill GHZ
changes: Updated to have A Ghost’s Pumpkin Soup as its tracklist

changes.title: (Base Slot) Training Room
changes: Revamped to have walls on both sides and a raised, Battlefield-like stage floating above the floor for testing edge cancels and ledge techniques on

changes.title: (X-alt) Online Training Room
changes: Moved from the Y-alt input for consistency reasons

changes.title: (L+R-alt) Green Screen FD (NEW!)
changes: A copy of FD with nothing but a green background, intended as a template for being overlaid in video creation

changes.title: (X-alt) WarioWare, Inc. (Brawl) (NEW!)
changes: Same as the base slot aside from giving the Brawl rewards of food, invincibility and gigantism instead of turbo

changes.title: (X-alt) Yoshi’s Island (Brawl) (NEW!)
changes: A variant of the base stage that maintains random Support Ghosts

moves.title: Characters and Gameplay
changes: C-Stick no longer has excessive deadzones, should prevent dropped inputs in most cases
Moving platform behavior fix redone to fix edge case warping
Various instances of clipping through stages fixed
Wall tech invincibility normalized cast-wide (20 frames)
No-hitstun/no hitlag moves now properly refresh recovery resources for select characters
Overtime now only applies to stock matches
Timer item no longer breaks animation and movement speeds of some moves
Break the Targets no longer shows titles for previous songs in Classic mode
Grab Release fix applied to inhales (characters with actionable recoveries now regain their move when spit out or swallowed)
Characters with more than 16 costumes no longer break horde battles
Springs will now not automatically center characters when landed on (examples include Sonic/Knuckles’ spring and the Spring item)
Charizard’s knockdown getup attack no longer sends opponents to the blastzone when shielded, along with other small file corruption problems
Ice Climbers can no longer get stuck to each other if hit frame perfectly out of Side Special
Slo-Mo Timer no longer breaks Nana
Ike will now enter Fall if pushed offstage during Up-B’s endlag
Mario and Luigi’s lying down getup attacks no longer have stray fixed knockback hitboxes
Marth’s Side Special can no longer retain momentum when going offstage from onstage
Removed unintended second puff graphic from Mr. Game & Watch’s up air, which would appear for exactly one frame in previous versions of P+
Pikachu will no longer clip through the stage after using Quick Attack
Fixed issue where Snake would keep billowing dirt clouds near his legs if the ending to the animation was interrupted
Fixed issue where dirt would instantly disappear at Snake’s feet if he interrupted the ending of the down smash placement animation
Sonic can no longer take an opponent’s jumps with Spring
Transforming back to Sheik from Zelda no longer removes the full-charge flash effect when she has a full needle charge

Smash attack charging damage fixed on ZSS, Ness and Knuckles to properly scale with charge. (Applies to ZSS’ up smash and forward smash, Ness’ up smash and down smash and Knuckles’ down smash when used downwards)
Issues related to Squirtle’s Final Smash entering the air resolved
Accounted for oversight where costume ranges for the color tinting of the armor on Giga Bowser’s down smash were incorrect

moves.title: Stages/Music
changes: Bowser’s victory theme in P+ Lite no longer loops
D-Pad functionality for alternate stage loading fixed
Fixed issue where trying to add more stages to page 3 than were present on page 1 would result in duplicate stage slots
Fixed issue where Battlefield’s lighting would instantly swap settings during certain times of the in-stage day
Fixed problem where Luigi’s Mansion had rendering issues near the lower entryways
Module for default/Brawl versions of Pictochat fixed
Golden Temple’s clouds now have smoother animation; foliage and polygon count on default and R-alt variations improved

moves.title: Other
changes: Bowser’s victory theme in P+ Lite no longer loops
Fixed PM-era issue where Classic and All-Star modes would mistakenly show you a picture of Zero Suit Samus instead of Wario-Man
Fixed issue where Boss Battles would crash if entered after exiting the All-Star rest area
Giga Bowser can now complete All-Star mode (a first for Brawl modding!)
Fighting Ridley no longer crashes Boss Battles
Boss Battles now gives proper ending
Samus AI will now crouch properly in Training Mode if set to do so

moves.title: Costumes
changes: Knuckles’ Z-alt is now Treasure Hunter Knuckles
Mario’s R alt (Sunshine Mario) revamped
Holy War Marth no longer has gloves, matching his Project M renders
Sunshine Peach semi-alt added, replacing the Sunshine Fire Peach recolor
Fire Peach has updated hair
Roy cosmetics revamped
Purple Fusion Suit slot added for both Samus and Zero Suit Samus
Brawl Samus costumes replaced with SJS Samus
Light Suit, Dark Suit and PED Suit Samus revamped
All Samus costumes now have updated poses and renders
Outset Island Toon Link revamped, given new symbols and designs on the recolors
Linebeck Toon Link clothing and sword revamped, now uses the Wooden Shield instead of Cyclone Slate
Sonic’s Z alt is now a Smash 2-styled Sonic
Dorrie Yoshi revamped with new textures and goggle changes
Yoshi’s Z-alt (Boshi) revamped
Many costumes and stages optimized for file size

moves.title: Character Polish
changes: Captain Falcon’s dash and Melee secret taunt animations cleaned up
Captain Falcon’s Final Smash utilizes formerly unused ending animation when started from the ground
Retro Falcon has implemented facial expressions to match the Brawl costume
Ike's Hector alt now has silver sword trail effects
Ike Climbers hidden alt now has hammer trail effects
Ike, Meta-Knight, Link and Toon Link have received new, costume-dependent sword glows to better match variances in sword appearances
Ike, Knuckles, Marth, Pit, Roy, Snake, and Zero Suit Samus received facial animation updates on various moves
Kirby’s Charge Shot now uses the same SFX as Samus’
Link’s bombs changed to aesthetically be a mixture of Brawl, Ocarina of Time, Twilight Princess and Hyrule Warriors to match all costumes better
Olimar’s Pikmin now have color-specific trail effects
Pit’s Dark Pit colors now have unique arrows, sword trails and a silver bow
Roy’s side taunt cleaned up so that the pauldron on his right shoulder doesn’t clip into his arm
ROB retains his Final Smash aura during his Final Smash’s duration
Snake's up tilt animation cleaned up
Snake’s down smash mine is now gray with a flashing top instead of purple
Snake’s down smash mine has been slightly raised in appearance to be consistently visible on all stages
Snake’s down smash dirt effect has been synchronized to the animation of digging
Snake transitions into crawl attack more smoothly and doesn’t immediately hold the knife at the start of it
Snake’s knife attacks now have glow effects, similar to other blades
Snake’s box walk taunt recoded to have smoother transitions between walking left and right
Sonic’s feet in his ball animations are no longer flat and scale properly

moves.title: Features
changes: Implemented new Hitbox, ECB, and Ledge renderers, and added Stage renderer into debug mode (HUD toggle is also not separate
UCF code reworked, should feel more accurate to Melee’s implementation
Various former PSA-based character attributes and features now moved into codeset or normalized with Brawl to make PSA porting easier
Air Dodge length is no longer dependent on tilt distance
“Shield” option in Training Mode no longer gives infinite shield (activate in Code Menu instead)
Various menu textures cleaned up

moves.title: Other
changes: Blast Boxes are now triggered by the aura element
Aura now thaws ice
Added cirb’s Project M Theme remix to the menu and the All-Star Rest Area
Song list updated; see music spreadsheet for tracklist details
Victory theme IDs changed, now only requires you to edit the tracklist for the results screen to customize each character’s theme!
All Brawl multiplayer stage music is now accessible on a stage (previously, 7 songs were left out)
All SSB64 multiplayer stage music is now included (previously, 3 songs related to 64 stages in the build were omitted)
Many songs optimized for filesize
Optional code for loading Character Select Portraits from the Result Screen Portraits file optimized, now no longer crashes
Wild Mode dialed back slightly in intensity
Dolphin will now auto-save replays from a netplay session! Use the Replay Manager executable to manage them.
Editing tracklists in offline Dolphin sessions will now work if booted with the Offline Launcher
Joining a Dolphin netplay lobby as “Spectator” will now automatically disable your port
WASAPI backend added to Dolphin
Fixed issue where certain adapter brands were not compatible with the Dolphin version included
Reduced audio delay in Dolphin
Strap and Results screens updated for version 2.2
